definitions: industrial site where clay bricks are manufactured and stored before distribution
examples: The old brickyard employed hundreds of workers during the construction boom
They found clay deposits perfect for starting a new brickyard

definitions: things or matters connected with a bride or wedding ceremony
examples: She tried on several bridal gowns before finding the perfect one
The bridal party arrived at the church early for photographs

definitions: man who is about to be married or has just been married
examples: The nervous bridegroom waited at the altar for his bride
As bridegroom, he organized the honeymoon arrangements

definitions: woman or girl who attends the bride at a wedding ceremony
examples: She asked her three sisters to be bridesmaids at her wedding
The bridesmaids wore matching lavender dresses

definitions: fortified position established by advancing troops on enemy side of river or obstacle
secure initial position from which further progress or expansion can be made
examples: The army established a bridgehead across the river before dawn
Allied forces defended the bridgehead against repeated counterattacks
The company used their first store as a bridgehead into the European market
This research grant provides a bridgehead for future scientific investigations

definitions: headgear used to control a horse consisting of headstall, bit, and reins
examples: She carefully adjusted the bridle before mounting her horse
The leather bridle needed cleaning after the muddy trail ride

definitions: flat rectangular case used for carrying papers, documents, and business materials
examples: He grabbed his briefcase and rushed to catch the morning train
Her leather briefcase contained important legal documents

definitions: meeting where information and instructions are given to prepare people for a task
examples: The daily briefing covered all major security developments
Pilots attended a weather briefing before their scheduled flights

definitions: prickly shrub or plant especially wild rose with thorny stems
examples: She scratched her arms pushing through the thick brier patch
Wild blackberry briers grew along the abandoned fence line

definitions: prison on a warship or naval base for military personnel
two-masted square-rigged sailing vessel used historically
examples: The sailor spent three days in the brig for insubordination
Guards escorted the prisoner to the ship's brig
The old brig sailed gracefully across the harbor
Pirates often preferred fast brigs for their raids

definitions: military unit typically consisting of three to six battalions forming part of division
organized group of people with particular purpose or shared activity
examples: The infantry brigade prepared for deployment overseas
Colonel Martinez commanded the third brigade during the operation
The volunteer fire brigade responded quickly to the emergency call
A brigade of activists marched through the city center

definitions: commissioned officer ranking above colonel and below major general in some armies
examples: The brigadier reviewed troops before the ceremonial parade
She was promoted to brigadier after twenty years of service

definitions: member of gang of thieves operating in mountainous or lawless areas
examples: Brigands attacked the merchant caravan in the mountain pass
Local villagers feared the brigands who controlled the forest roads

definitions: quality of being intensely bright or giving off vivid light
exceptional intelligence, talent, or skill in a particular area
examples: The brilliance of the diamond caught everyone's attention
Sunlight reflected with painful brilliance off the snow
Her mathematical brilliance earned scholarships to top universities
The brilliance of his legal arguments impressed the jury

definitions: upper edge or rim of cup, bowl, or other container
projecting edge around bottom of hat that shades face
examples: Coffee spilled over the brim of the overfilled mug
She filled the glass to the brim with ice water
He tipped his hat brim to shade his eyes from sun
The wide brim protected her face from sunburn

definitions: archaic term for sulfur especially when occurring naturally as yellow crystals
examples: Old texts described brimstone burning with blue flames
Miners extracted brimstone from volcanic deposits

definitions: water saturated with salt used for preserving food or other purposes
examples: She soaked the turkey in brine before roasting
Pickles fermented in brine for several weeks

definitions: action of carrying, conveying, or causing something to come to a place
examples: The bringing of gifts is traditional at this celebration
His bringing the evidence changed the entire case

definitions: edge of steep place or point at which something is about to happen
examples: She stood at the brink of the cliff looking down
The company teetered on the brink of bankruptcy

definitions: quality of being energetic, enthusiastic, and full of life or vigor
examples: The orchestra performed the piece with tremendous brio
She approached every challenge with characteristic brio

definitions: short stiff hair on animal or stiff fiber on brush
examples: The boar's bristles stood up when it felt threatened
She cleaned the floor with a brush having tough bristles

definitions: informal term for person from Britain or of British origin
examples: The Brits at our hotel were discussing cricket matches
As a Brit abroad, he missed proper tea

definitions: hard candy made with caramelized sugar and nuts that breaks easily
examples: Grandmother made peanut brittle every Christmas season
The brittle shattered when dropped on the counter

definitions: sharp pointed tool for making holes or opening casks
ornamental pin or clasp worn as jewelry especially on clothing
examples: The cooper used a broach to tap the wine barrel
He carefully positioned the broach before piercing the metal
She wore an antique diamond broach on her lapel
The emerald broach had been in her family for generations

definitions: person or organization that transmits programs on radio or television
examples: The veteran broadcaster announced his retirement after forty years
Major broadcasters competed for exclusive rights to the event

definitions: distribution of audio or video content to dispersed audience via electronic media
examples: She studied broadcasting at the communications college
Digital broadcasting replaced analog signals in most countries

definitions: process of becoming wider or more extensive in scope or range
examples: The broadening of the highway reduced traffic congestion
A broadening of perspectives came from international travel

definitions: newspaper printed on large sheets of paper associated with serious journalism
examples: The broadsheet covered international news in great detail
Many broadsheets switched to smaller formats to reduce costs

definitions: simultaneous discharge of all guns on one side of warship
large sheet of paper printed on one side with information or advertisement
examples: The warship fired a devastating broadside at the enemy vessel
Naval battles often began with massive broadsides
Political broadsides appeared on walls throughout the city
The broadside announced new trading regulations

definitions: rich fabric woven with raised pattern typically using gold or silver thread
examples: Her wedding dress featured beautiful gold brocade
Antique brocade curtains adorned the palace windows

definitions: cultivated plant with green flower heads eaten as vegetable
examples: She steamed fresh broccoli as a healthy side dish
The children reluctantly ate their broccoli at dinner

definitions: small book or magazine containing pictures and information about product or service
examples: The travel brochure featured beautiful beach destinations
She collected university brochures from the college fair

definitions: device or compartment used for cooking food by direct radiant heat
young chicken suitable for roasting or grilling
examples: She placed the steaks under the broiler for five minutes
The oven's broiler needed cleaning after cooking
The restaurant specialized in herb-seasoned broilers
Farm-raised broilers reached market weight in six weeks

definitions: person who buys and sells goods or assets for others
examples: The real estate broker showed them several suitable properties
She hired a broker to manage her investment portfolio

definitions: business of buying and selling for others or fee charged for this service
examples: The brokerage handled millions in daily stock transactions
They paid standard brokerage fees on all trades

definitions: compound of bromine with another element used in medicine and photography
trite or commonplace statement intended to soothe or placate
examples: Silver bromide was essential for traditional photographic film
The doctor prescribed bromide as a mild sedative
He offered only bromides about time healing all wounds
Political speeches often consisted of familiar bromides

definitions: reddish-brown volatile liquid element with choking vapor used in various compounds
examples: Bromine vapors require careful handling in the laboratory
Swimming pools sometimes use bromine instead of chlorine

definitions: untamed or partially tamed horse especially in western United States
examples: The cowboy struggled to stay on the bucking bronc
Wild broncs roamed the open rangeland

definitions: wild or half-tamed horse of western North America
examples: The bronco threw every rider at the rodeo
Cowboys practiced riding broncos on the ranch

definitions: brown metallic alloy of copper and tin used for tools and art
medal awarded for third place in competition traditionally made of bronze
examples: Ancient civilizations crafted weapons and tools from bronze
The bronze statue weathered to a green patina
She proudly displayed her Olympic bronze on the mantle
The team celebrated winning bronze at the championships

definitions: ornamental jewelry fastened to clothing with hinged pin and catch
examples: Her grandmother's pearl brooch held sentimental value
She pinned the silver brooch to her winter coat

definitions: family of young animals especially birds hatched at one time
examples: The hen protected her brood of twelve chicks
A large brood of ducklings followed their mother

definitions: deep thought about something that makes one sad, angry, or worried
examples: His constant brooding about the past worried his friends
Dark brooding filled her mind after the argument

definitions: female horse kept specifically for breeding purposes
examples: The champion broodmare produced several derby winners
They invested heavily in quality broodmares for their stable

definitions: small natural stream of fresh water
examples: Children played beside the babbling brook all summer
Trout swam in the clear mountain brook

definitions: brush with long handle used for sweeping floors
examples: She swept the kitchen floor with an old straw broom
The janitor's broom leaned against the supply closet

definitions: long thin handle of a broom
examples: The broken broomstick served as a makeshift walking cane
Children pretended broomsticks were horses in their games
